text:
I came across this wile trying to reproduce
http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=41638.

Steps to reproduce (as with 41638): 
1. Add HTTP Proxy Server to you WorkBench (leave all default settings)
2. Add Recording Controller to your WorkBench
3. Start HTTP Proxy Server
4. Disable Recording Controller
5. Open your browser (should be configured to work with HTTP Proxy Server) and 
go to any website.

Saved requests are being placed in "root" WorkBench node (I guess they shouldn't
save or some message should appear).

I'm java 6.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
If you tell the proxy server to use the Recording Controller and then disable 
the RC what else is JMeter supposed to do?

creator: ihsiak@tlen.pl
text:
It simply should not record anything.

Going your way it would mean that when you do 'format z:' command and there is
no z: drive, first available drive is formatted. I doubt any user would like
that effect.

I agree that this is minor problem and related to usability, but still should be
fixed.

(In reply to comment #3)
> If you tell the proxy server to use the Recording Controller and then disable 
> the RC what else is JMeter supposed to do?

So what is the real purpose of disabling Record Controller? In my opinion if you
disable it, should not record anything.
